title: Dario Amodei
content:
{{Short description|Italian-American entrepreneur}}
[[File:Dario Amodei in 2023.jpg|thumb|Dario Amodei in 2023]]
'''Dario Amodei''' is an Italian-American artificial intelligence researcher and entrepreneur. He is the co-founder of [[Anthropic]]. He is the former Vice President of Research at [[OpenAI]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/07/11/technology/anthropic-ai-claude-chatbot.html|title=Inside the White-Hot Center of A.I. Doomerism|first=Kevin|last=Roose|date=July 11, 2023|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://fortune.com/2023/07/10/anthropic-ceo-dario-amodei-ai-risks-short-medium-long-term/|title=Anthropic CEO A.I. risks: short, medium, and long-term | Fortune|date=July 11, 2023}}</ref>

==Education==
Amodei has an undergraduate degree from [[Stanford University]] and a PhD in physics from [[Princeton University]]. He was a postdoctoral scholar at the [[Stanford University School of Medicine]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.hertzfoundation.org/person/dario-amodei/|title=Dario Amodei}}</ref>

==Career==
In 2016, Amodei joined [[OpenAI]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/02/17/844721/ai-openai-moonshot-elon-musk-sam-altman-greg-brockman-messy-secretive-reality/|title=The messy, secretive reality behind OpenAI’s bid to save the world|website=MIT Technology Review}}</ref>

In 2021, Amodei and his sister Daniela founded [[Anthropic]] along with other former senior members of [[OpenAI]]. The Amodei siblings were among those who left OpenAI due to directional differences, specifically regarding OpenAI's ventures with [[Microsoft]] in 2019.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-04-07 |title=As Anthropic seeks billions to take on OpenAI, 'industrial capture' is nigh. Or is it? |url=https://venturebeat.com/ai/as-anthropic-seeks-billions-to-take-on-openai-industrial-capture-is-nigh-or-is-it/ |access-date=2023-05-24 |website=VentureBeat |language=en-US |archive-date=2023-05-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230524193007/https://venturebeat.com/ai/as-anthropic-seeks-billions-to-take-on-openai-industrial-capture-is-nigh-or-is-it/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

In July 2023, Amodei warned a United States Senate judiciary panel of the dangers of AI, including the risks it poses in the development and control of weaponry.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-07-25/anthropic-s-amodei-warns-us-senators-of-ai-powered-bioweapons|title=Anthropic’s Amodei Warns US Senators of AI-Powered Weapons|date=July 25, 2023|via=www.bloomberg.com}}</ref>

In September 2023, Amodei and his sister Daniela were named as two of the [[Time 100|''TIME'' 100]] Most Influential People in AI (''TIME''100 AI).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://time.com/collection/time100-ai/6309047/daniela-and-dario-amodei/|title=TIME100 AI 2023: Dario and Daniela Amodei|date=September 7, 2023|website=Time}}</ref>

In November 2023, the board of directors of OpenAI approached Amodei about replacing Sam Altman and potentially merging the two startups. Amodei declined both offers.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/technology/openais-board-approached-anthropic-ceo-about-top-job-merger-sources-2023-11-21/|title=OpenAI's board approached Anthropic CEO about top job and merger|first1=Jeffrey|last1=Dastin|date=November 21, 2023|via=www.reuters.com}}</ref>
